edit - i find “Bank” but i dont see any interface numbers when i search for that

item.title: Close Bank? Bank All
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

public static void addText(int id, String text, TextDrawingArea tda[], int idx, int color, boolean center, boolean shadow) { RSInterface tab = addTabInterface(id); tab.parentID = id; tab.id = id; tab.type = 4; tab.atActionType = 0; tab.width = 0; tab.height = 11; tab.contentType = 0; tab.opacity = 0; tab.hoverType = -1; tab.centerText = center; tab.textShadow = shadow; tab.textDrawingAreas = tda[idx]; tab.message = text; tab.aString228 = ""; tab.textColor = color; tab.anInt219 = 0; tab.anInt216 = 0; tab.anInt239 = 0; }

Read full topic

item.title: Close Bank? Bank All
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

ravekitty:

Uhm try adding an interface for it in client.java, i dont know the interface id for that location though… ^-^

RSInterface.java…

Try using this:

public static void bank(TextDrawingArea[] tda) { RSInterface t = interfaceCache[5292]; t.child(101, 19520, 0, 0); RSInterface t2 = addTabInterface(19520); addText(19521, "Swap", tda, 1, 0xff981f, false, true); addHoverButton(19522, "Bank/BANK", 17, 35, 25, "Deposit carried items", -1, 19523, 1); addHoveredButton(19523, "Bank/BANK", 18, 35, 25, 19524); t2.totalChildren(4); t2.child(0, 19521, 97, 301); t2.child(1, 19530, 0, 0); t2.child(2, 19522, 450, 288); t2.child(3, 19523, 450, 288); RSInterface t3 = addTabInterface(19530); }

Or you could just add the newer bank interface.
